subject: RMI Classloading bug in TestCaseClassloader?

messageBody:
This looks like a bug to me:

My TestCase class is testing a class that uses RMI to get some remote objects
(from a Jini lookup service, if you're interested/care).

The tests run clean when
-- I use the Swing TestRunner with *-noloading*,
[] specified on the cmd-line, or
[] loading=false in junit.properties, or
[] by switching it off in the GUI before running the test
-- when I use the text TestRunner,
but *fails* by getting unexpected exceptions (listed below) when I use the swing
TestRunner *with reloading*.

At this stage the testcase simply tests that the testee starts up Jini service
discovery correctly and discovers some services in the network on the theory
that there is no point in testing anything more if the rest of the network is
not available.

I have checked FAQs, and spent the best part of a morning trying to come up with
test cases that would replicate this bug, but confess that I'm stuck. (Also
tried searching the list archives, but it seems that yahoo's server died halfway
through my attempts.) Does anyone have experience of something similar in other
RMI-using situations? Or better yet, suggestions as to how I can put together a
test case to expose this!

----Exceptions: (This is one of several identical cases)

java.lang.ClassCastException: Assigning instance of class
net.jini.core.lookup.ServiceID to field com.sun.jini.reggie.RegistrarProxy#serviceID
at java.io.ObjectInputStream.inputClassFields(ObjectInputStream.java:2270)
at java.io.ObjectInputStream.defaultReadObject(ObjectInputStream.java:519)
at java.io.ObjectInputStream.inputObject(ObjectInputStream.java:1411)
at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readObject(ObjectInputStream.java:386)
at java.io.ObjectInputStream.readObject(ObjectInputStream.java:236)
at java.rmi.MarshalledObject.get(MarshalledObject.java:138)
at net.jini.discovery.IncomingUnicastResponse.<init>(IncomingUnicastResponse.java:78)
at net.jini.discovery.LookupDiscovery$UnicastDiscoverer.run(LookupDiscovery.java:322)
